        public static boolean shouldLog

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrapController

        public TrapController​(PIDFFConfig config,
                      edu.wpi.first.math.trajectory.TrapezoidProfile.Constraints constraints,
                      double period)
        Create a new object to control PID + FF logic using a trapezoid profile for a subsystem.

        Sets kP, kI, kD, kS, kV, kA, kG, constraints, period values.

        Parameters:
        config - PIDFFConfig object containing PID and Feedforward constants.
        constraints - Constraints for max acceleration and velocity
        period - The controller's update rate in seconds. Must be non-zero and positive.

      • TrapController

        public TrapController​(PIDFFConfig config,
                      edu.wpi.first.math.trajectory.TrapezoidProfile.Constraints constraints)
        Create a new object to control PID + FF logic using a trapezoid profile for a subsystem.

        Sets kP, kI, kD, kS, kV, kA, kG, constraints values.

        Parameters:
        config - PIDFFConfig object containing PID and Feedforward constants.
        constraints - Constraints for max acceleration and velocity

      • calculateFF

        public double calculateFF​(double pidOutput)
        Returns the Feed Forward output of the controller.

        Uses kS, kV, kA, and kG

        Specified by:
        calculateFF in class ControllerBase
        Parameters:
        pidOutput - the current measurement of the process variable.
        Returns:
        The controller output due to Feed Forward terms.

      • enableContinuousInput

        public void enableContinuousInput​(double minimumInput,
                                  double maximumInput)
        Enables continuous input.

        Rather then using the max and min input range as constraints, it considers them to be the same point and automatically calculates the shortest route to the setpoint.

        Overrides:
        enableContinuousInput in class ControllerBase
        Parameters:
        minimumInput - The minimum value expected from the input.
        maximumInput - The maximum value expected from the input.

      • atSetpoint

        public boolean atSetpoint()
        Returns true if the error is within the tolerance of the error.

        This will return false until at least one input value has been computed.

        Overrides:
        atSetpoint in class ControllerBase
        Returns:
        True if the error is within the tolerance of the error.
